messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Cute kidisms
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/14/02 1:35:40 PM, aisliin@yahoo.com writes: Holy cow!  You managed to not yell at your kids for ... I m with you Tia.  I stand in awe.
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/14/02 1:35:40 PM, aisliin@... writes:

<< >Holy cow! You managed to not yell at your kids for
>the first 5 or 6 years? I take my hat off to you.
>Tia

I'm with you Tia. I stand in awe. >>

I've met Susan and her family, and I believe she could go five years without
yelling. Her husband is really sweet and her girls are off the scale of
peaceable and helpful and interested in things. Probably a lot of that is
due to Susan being such a good mom and wife.

Puts me to shame, but I compensate by...

(thinking...)
playing recorder, or something.

Sandra

messages.messageBody:
>
>When my children were about 3 and 5-6 (2.75 years apart) I yelled at
>them for the first time and my youngest put her hands on her hips and
>faced me and said, "Gwownups shouldn't talk that way to chiwdrwens!" I

Holy cow! You managed to not yell at your kids for the first 5 or 6
years? I take my hat off to you.
Tia

No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
Eleanor Roosevelt

messages.subject: Cute kidisms
messages.msgSnippet: On Tuesday, August 13, 2002, at 12:11 PM, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com ... When my children were about 3 and 5-6 (2.75 years apart) I yelled at them for the
messages.messageBody:
On Tuesday, August 13, 2002, at 12:11 PM, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
wrote:

> When it was nearly ready she was talking to me about how many minutes or
> whatever, and I told her wait, I wasn't listening.
>
>
> She said "You shouldn't ignore me, mom, because that will ruin my life
> and
> I'll end up being mean to my kids."


When my children were about 3 and 5-6 (2.75 years apart) I yelled at
them for the first time and my youngest put her hands on her hips and
faced me and said, "Gwownups shouldn't talk that way to chiwdrwens!" I
ALWAYS remembered that and tried NOT to yell.

Susan
